title: Type Conversion
subject: C++ Programming
theory:
C++ introduces 4 specific cast operators (Safer than C-style `(int)x`). 
- `static_cast`: Normal conversion. 
- `reinterpret_cast`: Bitwise reinterpretation (Unsafe). 
- `const_cast`: Remove const.
- `dynamic_cast`: Polymorphic casting.

common_mistakes.correction: Hard to search in code and risky. Use C++ casts.

interview_questions.question: When to use dynamic_cast?
interview_questions.answer: When downcasting in inheritance hierarchy (Base* to Derived*). Checks validity at runtime (returns nullptr on fail). Need virtual table.
